results.title: Cost Effectiveness of ACEIs/ARBs versus Amlodipine Monotherapies: A Single-Center Retrospective Chart Review
results.text_hl: The findings of this study indicate that the use of ACEI or ARB as a monotherapy seems to be more effective than @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ monotherapy in the management of @<m>DISEASE_Essential_Tremor</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020329 @@@essential@@@ @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ in primary care settings with minimal incremental cost.

citations.NLM: AlRuthia Y, Alotaibi F, Jamal A, Sales I, Alwhaibi M, Alqahtani N, AlNajrany SM, Almalki K, Alsaigh A, Mansy W. Cost Effectiveness of ACEIs/ARBs versus Amlodipine Monotherapies: A Single-Center Retrospective Chart Review Healthcare (Basel). 2021 Jun 25;9(7):. PMID: 34202109

results.title: Comparative Efficacy and Safety of Amlodipine and Losartan Potassium in Essential Hypertension in a Tertiary Hospital of Bangladesh.
results.text_hl: The aim of the study was to compare the efficacy and safety of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ for the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Essential_Tremor</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020329 @@@essential@@@ @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (18-75 years).

results.title: Beneficial cardiometabolic actions of telmisartan plus amlodipine therapy in elderly patients with poorly controlled hypertension.
results.text_hl: METHODS: Seventeen elderly @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Essential_Tremor</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020329 @@@essential@@@ @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@HT@@@ who failed to achieve a target home BP level with treatment of 5 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ plus 80 mg @CHEMICAL_Valsartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068756 @@@valsartan@@@ or 8 mg @CHEMICAL_candesartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:C081643 @@@candesartan@@@ for at least 2 months were enrolled.

results.title: Valsartan Amlodipine Randomized Trial (VART): design, methods, and preliminary results.
results.text_hl: The Valsartan Amlodipine Randomized Trial (VART), a prospective randomized open-label trial, was designed to determine whether treatment with an @GENE_AGTR1 @GENE_185 @@@angiotensin II type 1 receptor@@@ blocker (@CHEMICAL_Valsartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068756 @@@valsartan@@@) or a calcium channel blocker (@<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@) lowers @DISEASE_Cardiovascular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D002318 @@@cardiovascular disease@@@ events in @<m>DISEASE_Essential_Tremor</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020329 @@@essential@@@ @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensives@@@ in Japan.

citations.NLM: Nakayama K, Kuwabara Y, Daimon M, Shindo S, Fujita M, Narumi H, Mizuma H, Komuro I. Valsartan Amlodipine Randomized Trial (VART): design, methods, and preliminary results. Hypertens Res. 2008 Jan;31(1):21-8. PMID: 18360014
